isis.stitle: TSI 05-02-01 - Diagnosis of Chassis Wander Complaints

geninfo.para: A simple steer axle caster check can be performed to address a chassis wander complaint after the dealer technician has verified the condition, the correct tire inflation and steering linkage/component function. Low or insufficient caster angle is a prime source for chassis wander complaints.

svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE

warning.para: To avoid property damage, personal injury, or death, park the vehicle on a flat level surface, set the parking brake, chock the wheels, and turn the engine off.

svcproc.para: Prior to performing this Service Procedure, ensure that the tire inflation is correct, and the steering linkage/ components are operating correctly.

note.para: An alignment rack or pit is not required for this basic check. Required is a level floor and a digital driveline angle measuring device (digital protractor), Part Number ZTSE4329 or equivalent ( Figure 1).

step1.para: Position chassis on a level floor.
If the chassis is so equipped, verify the air suspension bag height is correctly set.
Place the digital protractor on the spring pads of the front steer axle parallel to the spring assembly.

step2.para: Positive caster is indicated if the rear of the steer axle spring pad is lower than the front.

Caster which is at or near the lower end of the specification may be increased to the upper end of the specification if the wander complaint persists. Refer to TSI-04-02-01 Steer Axle Alignment Specifications.
A half degree more caster wedge on the passenger side is desirable to reduce drifting right tendencies due to road crown.

note.para: Changing steering gears to correct wander complaints should only be considered as a last resort. A steering gear change is not likely to affect the complaint condition.
